name: The Homer Multitext project on github
tagline: Archival data and software for working with editions of Homeric manuscripts
body:
## Current


- [hmt-archive][3]: the project's central data archive
- [hmt-digital][4]:  digital services for working with the Homer Multitext project archive
- [hmt-vm][5]:  a Vagrant virtual machine definition for editorial work on the Homer Multitext project
- [hmt-mom][6]: Mandatory On-going Maintenance, a build project for testing and validating editorial
work on the Homer Multitext project
- [hmt-utils][7]:  a JVM library implementing some HMT-specific functionality, such as tokenization of texts
following HMT project conventions

## In progress

- morpheus: a fork of the Alpheios modification of the Perseus morphological parser, extending
the morphological data set to cover all vocabulary in the Homer Multitext project archive
- hmt-editors-guide:  manual for HMT editors

## Other links

- the [Homer Multitext project web site][2]
- we rely on [the CITE architecture][1]


[7]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-utils

[6]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-mom

[5]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-vm

[4]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-digital

[3]: https://github.com/homermultitext/hmt-archive

[2]: http://www.homermultitext.org

[1]: http://cite-architecture.github.io/
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
